header.heading: Stream Keys
header.description: Manage and generate stream keys for connecting OBS or other broadcasting software to your channel.

instructionModal.heading: Step-by-Step Guide to Connecting OBS
instructionModal.description: Follow this detailed guide to create your stream key, configure OBS properly, and start broadcasting on our platform.
instructionModal.step1Description: To connect OBS, you must first create a stream key. This key links OBS to your channel and authorizes streaming.
instructionModal.downloadObsSescription: If OBS is not installed on your device, download the latest version from the official website.
instructionModal.copyKeysDescription: Copy both the Server URL and Stream Key. Keep them private — anyone with these details can stream on your behalf.
instructionModal.step2Description: Once your keys are generated, you need to insert them into OBS settings.
instructionModal.openObsDescription: Start the OBS Studio application on your computer.
instructionModal.openStreamSettingsDescription: Go to Settings → Stream to access the connection fields.
instructionModal.enterDetailsDescription: Paste the Server URL into the “Server” field and the Stream Key into the “Stream Key” field.
instructionModal.saveSettingsDescription: Click “Apply” and then “OK” to save your configuration.
instructionModal.step3Description: Everything is set up. You’re now ready to go live.
instructionModal.startStreamDescription: Press “Start Streaming” in OBS to begin broadcasting to your channel.
instructionModal.monitorStreamDescription: Return to your dashboard to ensure the stream is active and running smoothly.
instructionModal.congrats: OBS has been successfully connected to your channel!

createModal.ingressTypeDescription: Choose the connection type you want to use. The default RTMP option is recommended for most users.
